library(tidyverse)
df <- read_csv('Balque_Danielle_data.csv')


ggplot(df, aes(x = Steps, y = Mood)) +
    geom_point(color = "blue", size = 2) +
    geom_smooth(method = "lm")+
    labs(title = "                        Scatterplot of Steps vs. Mood Scale", x = "Steps", y = "Mood Scale")
    
correlation <- cor.test(df$Steps, df$Mood)
correlation

mysum <- df %>%
  group_by(Mood) %>%
  summarise(count = n(),
            means = mean(Steps),
            sds =sd(Steps)) %>%
          mutate(ses =sds/sqrt(count)) %>%
          mutate(cis = 1.96*ses)
          
show(mysum)


mean_mood <- mean(df$Mood)
sd_mood <- sd(df$Mood)
mean_steps <- mean(df$Steps)
sd_steps <- sd(df$Steps)

# Display the results
cat("Mean of Mood:", mean_mood, "\n")
cat("Standard Deviation of Mood:", sd_mood, "\n")
cat("Mean of Steps:", mean_steps, "\n")
cat("Standard Deviation of Steps:", sd_steps, "\n")


cor_test <- cor.test(df$Mood, df$Steps, method = "pearson")
cat("Pearson's correlation p-value:", cor_test$p.value, "\n")

# Spearman's correlation test (use if data does not meet assumptions for Pearson's test)
cor_test_spearman <- cor.test(df$Mood, df$Steps, method = "spearman")
cat("Spearman's correlation p-value:", cor_test_spearman$p.value, "\n")
